item.title: What are static websites and when to use them?
item.description: A static website is a website that is more like a document than a computer system. Unlike a traditional website, such as one built with WordPress, a static website doesn't rely on a web server to dynamically create the final document that is sent as a response when the document is requested from the web address.

item.title: “This is probably dumb…” - Herbert Lui
item.description: I’ve now been writing at this blog daily-ish for 100 days now. It’s probably dumb. It certainly would look that way—stupid. Idiotic. Irrelevant. Corny. Cringe. So cringe. (I suspect the youth look at blogs the same way they look at Lin Manuel Miranda.) Blogging is dumb, in a sense. Not only because people just don’t […]

item.title: where's all the code?
item.description: I already had a pretty good idea where all the code in the OpenBSD kernel was hiding but for the sake of comparison I wanted precise numbers. item.title: Introducing .NET MAUI - One Codebase, Many Platforms
item.description: Welcome to .NET Multi-platform App UI. This release marks a new milestone in our multi-year journey to unify the .NET platform. Now you and over 5 million other .NET developers have a first-class, cross-platform UI stack targeting Android, iOS, macOS, and Windows to complement the .NET toolchain (SDK) and base class library (BCL).

item.title: Visual Studio 2022 for Mac is now available
item.description: Now available: the general availability (GA) release of Visual Studio 2022 for Mac v17.0 . This is the fastest Visual Studio for Mac version yet with an all new native macOS UI, fully running on .NET 6, and optimized for Apple Silicon (ARM64) processors.

item.description: Kimchi is our new trustless zkSNARK that is based on the PLONK proof system and the Bulletproofs commitment scheme. The goal of this post is to relieve the symptoms produced after reading the former paper.
